mission.name: Knock Knock
mission.desc: After foiling the dastardly plans of Doctor Mechau, you prepare to depart from the city of Luminis. Just before you take off, you are interrupted by a knock on the ship's hull. It's Dilbert, the insect architect from Beetleton Bunker!

line.text: R-Remember me, adventurer? Oh, gods! It feels like it's been years since we last talked.
The Goblins might have the Spellstone Hammer now, but we've been working around the clock to rebuild our fair city.
Say what you will about him, but if Kattoraki proved one thing, it's that nothing is stronger than love...
So strong, in fact, that people keep telling me the city is too cramped.
With all the new grubs crawling around, there just aren't enough houses anymore.

mission.name: Beetleton Baby Boom
mission.desc: An exhausted Dilbert explains that the next generation of insects is in need of a new home: one that's built even deeper into the Beetleton cave network. But he seems fearful about the prospects of digging deeper...

line.text: We were starting to dig when we found... some real, honest-to-the-gods ancient ruins!
We hoped you could help scout the area, Adventurer. But first, you should see our beautiful city!

mission.name: Joy to the Bunker
mission.desc: Though you aren't looking forward to the 'exotic' insect cuisine, you agree to accompany Dilbert back to Beetleton. The underground city is alive with vibrant leaves, mushrooms, and bugs, happier and busier than ever before.

line.text: This is the harmony our Carnival of Couples has created!

mission.name: We Need to Go Deeper
mission.desc: Dilbert directs your airship past the festivities and swarming citizens, into the depths of the underground. The ship's headlights only barely pierce through the gloom. You grow more and more unsettled the farther you fly.

mission.name: The Crash
mission.desc: A skittering sound echoes through the pitch-black caves, growing steadily louder... then, silence. After a brief pause, something collides with the ship! Gripping the wheel, you're forced to land in unrelenting darkness.

line.text: M-Mayday! MAYDAY!

mission.name: Poisonbolt from the Blue
mission.desc: When you and Dilbert emerge from the wreckage, you spot the cause of the unexpected landing. A foul, green projectile has soaked into the hull. Fortunately, the ship's headlamps still work... It's not much, but it's a start.

line.text: Oh, thank the gods... We're safe!
Wait, where are we?
NONE SHALL PASSSSS

mission.name: Sunless Stone
mission.desc: After fending off the ambush, you follow the headlamps' light to a foreboding stone structure that leads even deeper into the depths. You recognize the style of carvings from the Forgotten Island, where you first met Agatha.

line.text: This is it, Adventurer! The ruins I was telling you about!
But it looks like something happened since my team was here last.
These doors weren't open before... I don't like this...

mission.name: Open Wide
mission.desc: There are obvious scorch marks marring the double doors ahead. You brace yourself for another struggle. Dilbert follows behind you in trepidation as you venture deeper inside, holding an old, beaten-up lantern full of fireflies.

mission.name: Inner Sanctum
mission.desc: You descend the first flight of stairs you see. The moment you enter the next chamber, torches on the walls suddenly crackle to life with crimson flame. The room is bathed in light, and an elaborate mural is unveiled before your eyes.

line.text: Adventurer, look at these old drawings!
I don't believe it! These look like...
It is! This is what Beetleton Bunker looked like when my great-great-great-grandpa was a grub!
But, if this building is related to Beetleton...
Why did no one discover it until recently?

mission.name: The Spraying Mantis
mission.desc: You're about to ponder Dilbert's question when you hear a harsh skittering sound, distant at first, but gaining and gaining fast. A huge, armored mantis darts into the sanctum. Liquid drips from its sickles as it lets out a hiss.

line.text: Aaaah! Adventurer! Watch out!
That creature! I know that scent!
That's the poison that damaged the airship...!

mission.name: Rhynio Reunion
mission.desc: The mantis's head rears back, and its eyes glow a fearsome green. But before it can spit its toxins at you, a bolt of fiery magic strikes it. It manages to fire a gout of green liquid harmlessly against the wall before collapsing to the floor.

line.text: Helvius! That is enough! You will not harm another innocent!
Champion... what brings you here, to this painful reminder of olden times?
We're here to explore these ruins! Beetleton Bunker depends on it.
I am afraid you've dug far too deep for your own good.
This was once a secret haven for the Rhynio, when the Forgotten Hero was my child... my pride and joy.
When the Void surged through our island, a chosen few braved the darkness connecting us to the mainland.
We erected this. A shelter, if the Crimsonwings should fall.
But nobody's here but that... monster!

mission.name: Myth Warden's Despair
mission.desc: A look of grief clouds Agatha's face. She closes her eyes, fluttering over to the wall behind you. Your eyes follow her, and at last you understand. Pictured there is the mantis, applying a green poultice to another insect's wounds.

line.text: Helvius was once the pride of the Rhynio people, beetle.
But when he stayed behind to heal the sick, he succumbed to the power of the Void. Soon, he was beyond even our reach.
Our finest Sun Warriors could not break the curse and return his mind. So, we had no recourse...
We sealed him away in this sanctuary, a place we once called our safe haven from the Void.
And, in the end, the rest of our civilization would follow him into the abyss.

mission.name: A Rock and a Dark Place
mission.desc: Beyond Helvius's sanctum lies a seemingly endless maze of cave passages. Agatha escorts you and Dilbert through the darkness, guided only by her memory. You ask yourself if it's even possible to escape.

mission.name: Weapons, Warnings, Worms
mission.desc: The deeper you travel, the more you spot the discarded weapons of fallen soldiers. Agatha's wings hesitate. She's reluctant to fly any farther, since she can smell something she calls a Phomoran Ogerworm.

mission.name: I've Just Been in This Place Before
mission.desc: Agatha describes a massive, nearly immortal beast with a sharp mind and an aggressive temperament. You can't help but think of Nophora, a foe so fearsome that you only barely survived it when a cave-in saved you...

mission.name: Bold and Boulder
mission.desc: Before you waits a boulder with fourteen writhing legs. You take a hesitant step closer, and it crumbles to pieces! Nophora emerges from underneath, its red eyes full of hate. Orange poison leaks from its body.

mission.name: Phomo-Rollercoaster Ride
mission.desc: The worm lunges at you, but its injuries have made its movements slow and telegraphed. Leaping to one side, you manage to climb onto Nophora's body. It screams. You're forced to hold tight as it goes on a blind rampage!

mission.name: The Last Wriggle
mission.desc: You hold onto the tiny spikes covering Nophora's segments with a steely grip. They act as footholds, even as they dig into your body. At last, you climb to the top of Nophora's head... and plunge your blade deep into its eye!

mission.name: Prologue
mission.desc: Amidst thunder and lightning, mysterious shadows are engaged in a hushed conversation with a hooded goblin witch

line.text: When shall we meet again?
When the battle is lost and won.
Where?
Hover through the fog and filthy air.

mission.name: Up in the Air
mission.desc: You finally make your way back to the surface, as Dilbert and his carpenters do their best to make the ship airworthy again. But after rejoining Ursurio, you notice someone unusual in the distance.

line.text: I think that's the best we can do without the Hammer or finding new parts.
Having surveyed the damage, you should count yourself lucky!
But at least we saved all our food provisions!
Hold up! Why don't we just ask that ship up there for spares?
Whoa there, I recognise that ship! But my eyes must be deceiving me! Was it something I ate?
Curses! The others must also be huntin' for The Hoarder's weapons.

mission.name: Back from the Dead
mission.desc: Confused as to how a very un-undead Xerkahn has returned, you travel to Karthos to seek Tarian for an explanation.

line.text: I'm as confused as you all. I've had no reports of unusual activity, and I'm sure I would have noticed her coming back from the dead.
And you're absolutely certain she was fully alive? Not an undead rancor?
There's no mistaking her and her flagship!
I guess you're all here looking for the same thing I am...
Answers.

mission.name: Double Trouble
mission.desc: The armored goblin continues his surprisingly eloquent tale. It would seem that Xerkahn is not the only goblin that has returned from the dead.

line.text: I'm afraid those goblins always remained loyal followers of Reks. War was inevitable as soon as news spread.
And what's his goal?
To reclaim the throne, I'm sure.
Hold right there, goblin. You haven't told us who you are. For all we know, you could be a spy.

mission.name: If You Stare Into the Void
mission.desc: Tarian is suspicious of the goblin and wants to know who this visitor to Karthos is.

line.text: And you never asked until now. Very well, allow me to introduce myself. I am...
I was once a centurion in Daknak's personal guard. But fear not. I have no quarrel with you.
Rather than work with Boldur, Daknak has gone chasing rumors. He's looking for weapons Remi might have left behind.
But even if they exist, they will be infused with the Void. He is foolish to think he can handle them.
Daknak made his decision. I was not prepared to follow.

mission.name: The Void Stares Back Through You
mission.desc: Armed with the knowledge that Daknak, and likely Xerkahn also, are seeking out a cache of Void weapons, you start pondering on where to begin your search. Little do you realize other eyes were looking at you...

line.text: Well, that would explain why Xerkahn was near Nophora's lair. The worm is known as a weapon hoarder.
Aye, aye, cap'n Sivun. Target spotted!
Ack! I didn't mean it like that!

mission.name: A Civil War
mission.desc: Interfactional fighting has consumed the goblin tribes. Spurred by sightings of their former king, goblins have risen up against Boldur. Compounding the chaos, Daknak has also raised an army, driven by ambition and rumors of powerful treasure, ignoring even his most loyal advisors.

line.text: You will find what you desire at your journey's end.
Daknak find treasure! Daknak use treasure! Daknak do what Boldur does not!
Daknak jump into Void! Daknak owe no explanation to those who stand and watch!

mission.name: Stolen Eye-dentity
mission.desc: Back in Karthos, Xerkahn's goblins have begun an air assault. Far above the mountaintops, you can spot a blind goblin leader shouting orders.

line.text: Nuvis!
That not Nuvis! That Sivun! Nuvis brother! Nuvis steal Sivun eyes as joke at Goblin Military School. Sivun hate Nuvis!
More ships over there!
Hand over the weapons ya got from that worm!

mission.name: When You Come At the King...
mission.desc: The skies fill up with ships from multiple factions. You know you don't possess what Xerkahn is demanding but aren't quite sure how to convince her. Taking evasive maneuvers, you find yourself near a squadron of dragon-riding goblins.

line.text: Well, well, well. I wouldn't believe it if I didn't see it with my own two eyes.
There's our signal lads! Follow Sivun's lead!
BOMBS AWAY!!!
Daknak see Nuvis brother! Daknak order Nuvis attack!

mission.name: You Best Not Miss
mission.desc: Bombs burst in the skies above Karthos as the goblin civil war explodes into an all out air battle. You send out a call for help. But unbeknownst to you, Daknak has boarded your ship. Though some, more so than others, are unhappy to see him, he has come with an offer.

line.text: Daknak see many familiar faces! Daknak not friends with those faces.
But Daknak come in peace. Daknak need help.
Daknak air commander tells him Reks is fake Reks. Nuvis say he see real identity

mission.name: Identity Revealed
mission.desc: You agree to work with Daknak to lure the imposter king into a trap. Your aerial reinforcements from Yuriel and Samael arrive just in time. Daknak sends his air force as bait whilst you send the owl mystic armed with his knowledge of dispelling magic.

line.text: HUH?! What? Who are you?!
Time to find out who you really are!
NO! ARGH! THE LIGHT!
... you!
Damnation!

mission.name: An Angel in Goblin Clothing
mission.desc: You unmask the real identity of the returning king: Gobtoh! But before you can ponder the important questions such as whether Xerkahn is real or whether Reks' followers also saw, you find yourself attacked from all sides.

mission.name: Return to the Convergence
mission.desc: Tailing Gobtoh from the ashes of Karthos, you arrive in the sanctum at the center of Dawnglow Swamp, where elements and factions collide.

line.text: Look! Daknak sees him! Daknak sees Gobtoh!

mission.name: War Comes Home
mission.desc: The rumour of a secret stash of weapons, and therefore the goblins' infighting, has spread all throughout Conflux Convergence.

line.text: Destroy the Chaos scum!
You'll never escape Sivun!
Long live the Aether!
Fear the might of my true self, the great Gobtoh Ascended!!
Ah-hahahahaaa!

mission.name: Aether's Chagrin
mission.desc: From the comfort of the airship, Yuriel, Samael, and seemingly Daknak all watch on with dismay. As members of the Aether, they instinctively shrink away from such anarchy.

line.text: Whooo could just stand there and watch this...? It's senseless.
We must stay the course. You and I once fought the Goblins as one tribe.
They'll be left with nothing if the war continues.
Even the weakest goblin child knows that no one can battle forever.

mission.name: Daknak Plan!
mission.desc: Daknak lets slip that he might know a shortcut to end the war.

line.text: Daknak sees where Gobtoh hid Remi's weapons.
With weapons in Daknak's hand, I rule! Daknak bring peace as king of the Goblins, forever and ever!

mission.name: Final Warning
mission.desc: Samael's face darkens at the mere mention of the Void. As a former victim of its curse, he has sworn never to allow another being under its thrall.

line.text: Daknak, you fool... Your centurion was right! You have no idea what madness you speak!
Anyone who claims they can control the Void is playing with a fire worse than any Chaos's magic!

mission.name: A Warning Unheeded
mission.desc: Daknak refuses to listen to Samael. He leaps from the airship, right onto the battlefield, and draws his cursed blade!

line.text: Bahaha! Angels too WEAK to understand Daknak plan! Just like Boldur! WEAK!!

mission.name: Chasing a Dream
mission.desc: Samael balls his hands into fists and vows to slay every Goblin who dares pursue Remi's cache of Void weapons any farther.

line.text: Traitor! You will pay for your hubris!
I don't care if I have to wield Dyrnwyn against your entire tribe. No mortal trifles with the Void!
Hooo... adventurer, will you go with him?
The last time he got like this, I had to clean the ashes out of my feathers for 11 days straight!

mission.name: Elemental Meltdown
mission.desc: In the Convergence, you notice enraged Elementals that awoke in response to the war. As an Elemental himself, Remi's cache threatens this world's balance.

line.text: WHOOOSH!!
GLOOOOP!!
I was afraid of this... We'll fend them off together, adventurer!

mission.name: Daknak Found!!
mission.desc: You and Samael find Daknak only to notice he has found something too. Daknak reaches for an elaborate pocket watch, which you immediately recognize it as Remi's.

line.text: The secret weapon... is TIME!
With time on Daknak's side, Daknak change the flow of the war!
Daknak turn all Goblins slow with the power of the Void!!!
Hands off that piece of clockwork, Daknak!
Remi the Banished was barred from the elemental plane for his folly!
Who knows what will happen if you try to use his powers for yourself?!

mission.name: Crossed Swords
mission.desc: Samael draws Dyrnwyn, the legendary sword that severs the Void. Angel and goblin battle in a flurry of blades. Black clouds fall over the horizon, portending a decisive battle!

mission.name: Daknak Time!!!
mission.desc: Daknak makes a sudden, valorous strike that stuns Samael long enough for him to grab Remi's pocket watch.

line.text: You don't know how long Daknak waited for this...!
No more Boldur! No more war! Daknak reign supreme over all Goblinkind!
Then everyone listen to Daknak for once!
Everyone stop forgetting Daknak, and treating Daknak like weak outcast!!
Daknak is strong! And goblins finally THINK Daknak strong!
Daknak, you IDIOT! You've doomed us all!!

mission.name: Cataclysm
mission.desc: The instant Daknak touches the watch, a fearsome power emanates from within it! An explosion of Void magic cracks the air open. The cracks spread across the sky. And the world shatters...

line.text: Now look what you've done!
I know this magic. It's the ultimate power of the Void... but it's never done this before!
What's happening...?!
All Daknak wanted was... respect!

mission.name: Isn't It Neat?
mission.desc: After what feels like an eternity, you awaken alone in a cold, forbidding cave. What looks like a waterfall flows down from the entrance. Fishes flit by.

mission.name: Wall of Wonders
mission.desc: Entranced by the beautiful sight spreading out before you, you gaze beyond the falls. The depths of the Pharos Temple spread out before you. The water smells of something foul.

mission.name: She Who Holds the Tide
mission.desc: A fierce-looking woman with blue skin greets you tersely, though she does not look at you. Her hands move with the flow of the waterfall, keeping it intact.

mission.name: A Protean Proteus
mission.desc: The woman introduces herself as Tethys, but before she can say any more, a dark shape bursts through the falls and swings his sword! You narrowly dodge to find... Proteus?!

line.text: Kreeeargh! You shall bow before the might of King Proteus!

mission.name: Float Like a Merman, Sting Like a Bird
mission.desc: Proteus' beard is bedraggled. His eyes are wrong. You can feel them trained on you. He cleaves the air, his sword soaring on invisible wings. He shrieks like a hungry hawk.

line.text: For the glory of the ocean! Let the waters swallow Arcantica whole!
HERETIC!!

mission.name: Tethys' Boon
mission.desc: Tethys' arm drops calmly to her side. Summoned by her magic, the fearsome shark warrior Zolmosh headbutts Proteus from behind! He coughs up black ooze, defeated.

line.text: Keee... For the glory of the... ocean...
Foolish infidel. Lady Scylla yet lives! The Watershaper foretells all!
...Squawk... Kaww...
Now STAY down, Proteus of the Void. You cannot stop our Maelstrom!

mission.name: Prophet of the Falls
mission.desc: Tethys congratulates Zolmosh on a job well done, then parts the waterfall. At last, you can see the skies above... A thunderstorm the color of an oil slick roils overhead.

line.text: Tethys the Watershaper has spoken!
With the ocean king at bay, the Maelstrom is here at last!
Come to us, Lady Scyll--
ARRRRRR!!

mission.name: Sea, Meet Sky
mission.desc: In a flash of crimson, the righteous berserker Alyel descends before you can even see her coming! You blink. Tethys has fallen to one knee. The foul, dark sea beyond you stills.

line.text: Even with the Void returned, these freaks still try to summon Scylla back from the dead...
I will never understand it.
Come on, adventurer. Let's regroup in Duskwillow...
...once that stupid ship gets here, that is. Why is everyone so slow?

mission.name: Dressed to Plunder
mission.desc: The Undead Armada and the Dragon Family arrive not long after, their fleet of battleships now helmed by a strangely familiar new crew.

line.text: So, intel was right. They WERE somewhere near Pharos. But why...?
Zolmosh dares not tell an angel.
Zolmosh especially dares not tell them this used to be the sacred site of Lady Scylla and Lord Typhoeus!
But oh, that fool Proteus. He thought he could be king without the blessings of the--
*Traps Zolmosh in a bubble*
...Shut up. No landlubber wants to hear th' cult of Scylla ramblin'.

mission.name: All Aboard
mission.desc: Your allies welcome you aboard the Undead Armada's ship. Though it's unexpected to see angels working side by side with orcs and undead, you can't help but think Lev would be proud.

line.text: We have the Adventurer! Now, to Duskwillow, and to arms!
You know, Alyel, you're almost sounding like a real leader.
Isn't it a grand thing to share the throne for once?
I don't know why I never considered it sooner.
Aye. Even if the Goblins are fightin', at least we can have a little peace here.

mission.name: Spoken Too Soon
mission.desc: Proteus awakens from his Void sickness. But as you and your uncommon allies; pull away from shore, you have still left Tethys and Zolmosh basically unattended...

line.text: Mother Tethys...? I thought you were retired.
Things change, "King" Proteus. What's forgotten cannot stay forgotten forever. Thousands of Brinesouls came together for this! The Maelstrom is here!
...Why must you continue to use the serpents like this, Mother? The Void has tainted our waters so thoroughly. Not even Scylla's full fury could prevent that...
I don't know. I just thought that our line knew better. Those two are wild beasts. Forces of nature.
Lord Typhoeus would be ten times the king you are.
...Silence, raider.

mission.name: The Maelstrom Begins
mission.desc: The Watershaper grimaces. She's come too far. Tethys raises her arms. The tides rise higher, more violently, until the ocean becomes a cascade that blots out the sky.

line.text: So... that is your answer, Mother.
Maybe the Void should have destroyed us after all.

mission.name: A Quick Regroup
mission.desc: Even with the Seafolk raiders' Maelstrom thwarted, the clouds remain as ominous as ever. Your allies bring you from Pharos to Duskwillow and back to the airship.

line.text: I s'pose you've got to be confused. The skies went dark during the Goblin Civil War, and it's drivin' th' world mad!
After it happened, Samael petitioned the rulers of Skyhaven to send out a search party.
You had disappeared completely, Adventurer.
We were lucky to find you when we did. You were almost another casualty...

mission.name: A Chill in the Air
mission.desc: The triumvirate of angels steers the ship up past the clouds, to a Skyhaven that looks shrouded in an endless night. Only the city lights are able to illuminate your path.

line.text: Strange, isn't it? It's the middle of the day, and yet the Void cloud has covered everything.
At least Samael will be relieved to see you.

mission.name: Put on... Ice?
mission.desc: As you approach the blackened city, sharp shards of frost zip past your craft. Not wanting a repeat of what happened with Helvius, you take the helm and deftly avoid them!

mission.name: Giving a Hoot
mission.desc: You can't shake an ominous feeling as you touch down in Skyhaven. After reuniting with Yuriel and Samael, your suspicions are confirmed. The Void is running rampant!

line.text: Hoot! There you are! Took you long enough!
Adventurer, things are as dire as they have ever been. The Void has been unbound.
It's been spreading across the world... and the delicate balance of the factions is ruined!

mission.name: That's No Angel
mission.desc: Samael explains that the Void's newly unleashed power has infected all of Arcantica. Every tribe is behaving completely differently from their usual selves!

line.text: The Seafolk of Pharos and Duskwillow screech and stare like Avians...
The Dragons of Tarragon Peak mount violent barrages like Goblins...
And the Angels of Skyhaven are--
COME... WITH... US...!
Whooo dares?! Back, you demon! Back!

mission.name: City of the Damned
mission.desc: You repulse the Void underling, only to find the entire city swarming with them. In your brief absence, demons have overrun Skyhaven like an Undead horde!

line.text: Come, Adventurer. Let us take back the capital of the Angels!
Glory to our sanctified cities!

mission.name: Alyel's Pride
mission.desc: You, Yuriel, and Samael step back out onto the streets of the demon-infested Skyhaven. The three queens have already charged into battle, but one fights well beyond the rest.

line.text: Gnaaargh!
HAH, IS THAT ALL YOU'VE GOT?! MAY I HAVE ANOTHER?!?
Save some demons for the rest of us, sister!
BUTT OUT! I'M EARNING THE THRONE FOR REAL THIS TIME!

mission.name: No Mind to Think?
mission.desc: The berserking Alyel tears the demons apart before they can even mount an offense, as quick as the legendary Sword Saint Katto. But when the coast seems clear...

line.text: Hmph! A job well done. Once again, I can call myself an ally of all that is good and just.
Pesky Angel... fast! Call for... aid!

mission.name: Ascending the Chain of Command
mission.desc: The demonic legions regroup and coalesce around a now-familiar face: it's Gobtoh, the angel who had only just served as a pretender to the Goblin throne!

line.text: Heh heh, now THIS will be a battle worth remembering!
Even though that stopwatch I hid is still out there somewhere...
And these demons, I'm sure you can tell by now, are as weak as water...
I, Gobtoh Ascended, shall bring you de--

mission.name: Archangel of Frost
mission.desc: Before Gobtoh can yammer any more, he is silenced when a sudden chill blunts his every attempt to move. Then a ring of falling icicles fences him in, and he faints from the cold.

line.text: Maaaster... come back to us, Master!
Hooo! Now that's what I call a deus ex machina!
More like deus ex Melkira. A last-minute savior, so it seems.
We have little to fear from the Goblins and their hordes after all.
Be on your guard, everyone. The Void won't take kindly to this.
At least, with my incredible speed, you all have nothing to fear!

mission.name: Something to Fear
mission.desc: A Goblin battleship suddenly appears on the horizon, carried on the backs of a thousand dragons, and cuts through the clouds. Xerkahn emerges, holding a stopwatch!

line.text: Ah-hahahahaaa! Hear me, my hordes! Destroy the Angels! Overrun them! There is strength in numbers!
At least if you die, I can always turn back the clock!
So this is what happened to Remi's watch after Daknak got hold of it...
That fool... Respect is earned, not simply given!
AND I'LL BE THE ONE TO EARN IT! STAND BACK, EVERYONE!
WE ALL YELL FOR ALYEL!!!

mission.name: Clipped Wings
mission.desc: With the power of Remi's watch, Xerkahn unleashes a blast of magic that distorts the flow of time. Alyel fights on, but her movements are sluggish and weak. The Angels realize they're outnumbered...

line.text: What... did you... DO to me...?!
Enjoy fighting as slowly as everybody else, Bawl-yel!
Ah-hahahahaaa!
They've stricken down my sister?!
Retreat, everyone! We must retreat!
I'm sure the healers of Golden Crown will be able to cure your sister. Adventurer, take Alyel and run!

mission.name: Toil and Trouble
mission.desc: As the void storm rages, shadowy figures once again congregate under the gloomy, portentous clouds.

line.text: Double, double toil and trouble. Fire burn, and cauldron bubble.
Eye of newt and toe of frog...
Toe of frog...

mission.name: Not Fast but Furious
mission.desc: You travel to Golden Crown Village as quickly as the void clouds allow, but not as fast as Alyel would have liked. It's a bumpy, cold journey, but nowhere near as cold as the welcome once you arrive.

line.text: Gah! Everything takes so long now! Why must I wait?!
Oh no, more sick angels looking for a cure. Go away! Our waiting rooms are full!

mission.name: Emergency Village
mission.desc: You and your weakened Angel allies are not the only ones to have come seeking treatment. Moths, crows, drakes, almost anything with wings, have made the journey up into the treetops.

line.text: This is a sorry sight. Insects, Avians, Angels, Dragons. This coming Void certainly spares no tribe. Infected, corrupted and weakened souls as far as my eyes can see.
Did you not hear me the first time? Hop off!
Easy there, Scout! I know these faces. Let them pass.
Cedric! My old friend. It's good to see you. I assume you know why we're here.

I can guess. Unfortunately, I have bad news. It seems all of Arcantica came here seeking a cure. But it was only the infected that came, and that of course brought the Void to the Village. We could only hold on for so long before the inevitable...

mission.name: Absolute Corruption
mission.desc: You learn of the dreadful news that the healers of Golden Crown Village were unable to handle such a concentration of sickness and have themselves succumbed to the Void corruption.

line.text: ... and even after we cured them, some changed back into the Void and continued to spread the confusion.
But as long as you stay here, in the outskirts, the concentration is still low enough for us to ...
It's an air raid! Take cover!

mission.name: Familiar Tactics
mission.desc: As bombs begin bursting in the air, you can't help but notice the similarities to Goblin tactics. It appears, you've simply traded the demonic anarchy for a new barrage filled anarchy.

line.text: Barrage bombs? It must be Goblins! That scoundrel Xerkahn must have followed us. Or maybe it's Remi? Let me at them...
Not so fast, Alyel!
Sorry, what I mean is that the tribes have been behaving completely differently from their usual selves. I hear the Dragons of Tarragon Peak have mounted violent barrages.
Ah yes, you too have observed this. Yet, I must correct you. It is not the drakes that are behaving like Goblins, but the Frogs that ride those drakes...
You!

mission.name: The Emperor Strikes Back
mission.desc: Suddenly the mastermind of the barrage appears and it's not a Goblin. It's another old nemesis!

line.text: Of course you're the source of all this confusion and madness! First you destroy my Guardian Stone. Then you subvert my Mechanical Titan.
And now you come spreading the Void and confounding my most loyal servants, who are neither blind nor lucky anymore!
And you Cedric! Of course you are on the Golden Leaf side. Well, no matter! Acting like Goblins has some benefits.
BOMBS AWAY!

mission.name: Frog Civil War
mission.desc: The corrupting influence of the Void has shattered the peace between the Frogs of Dawnglow Swamp and Golden Crown Village. Fighting is slowly but surely consuming all of the tribes.

mission.name: The Missing Mayor
mission.desc: You realise that you aren't the only group on a mission to find the Mayor of Golden Crown Village. Yet, no one can seem to locate the Matriarch, nor her son.

line.text: But if you see that old hag of a Mayor, or her son, I want them captured alive!

mission.name: A Veteran's Eye
mission.desc: Amidst the barrage, the old retired First Sword has spotted something curious: something very much from Dawnglow.

line.text: Are you seeing what I'm seeing, adventurer?
Though you say the Void has changed the behaviour of the Dawnglow Frogs, they still retain some typical characteristics.
They're spitting poisonbolts amongst the barrage. Curious. Unless she's gone to the Emperor already, I doubt they've been cured.

mission.name: Classically Froggy
mission.desc: Before you can ponder as to how the Dawnglow Frogs have mitigated the Void infection, you're forced to take evasive measures to avoid those very same bolts of poison.

line.text: I thought you were done repeating the Helvius incident!

mission.name: Dear Friends...
mission.desc: By a stroke of fate, your airship safely lands next to what appears to be a letter nailed to trunk of a tree. A letter that appears to be written by the Matriarch...

line.text: Dear Friends,
I was curing the Emperor's Dreamer when I realized that what we are doing here is pointless. It must have been obvious to her too that no one can defeat the Void.
The village council and I have to decided to return to the swamps, escape the Void and live in quiet peace and harmony with our families.
I have only one request. If you ever considered yourselves our friends, do not follow. This is for the best.
Signed, Ribberta.
Former Mayor and Matriarch of Golden Crown Village.

mission.name: Written in the Stones
mission.desc: Without the Mayor, there is no cure and seemingly no hope. You rest for the night, as one sliver of optimism comes to you in your dreams...

line.text: Do not be alarmed, adventurer, for I have caught this dream to give you aid.
Cedric was indeed observant to see the Emperor's army retained some of their identity.
The source of the protection is not from our Mayor but from the runes they carry. Though small, they have of reversed some of the Void's effects.
The runes appear to have been carved from the stone of Tarragon Peak. Perhaps there lies the answers you seek...

mission.name: You Had A Dream
mission.desc: You leave Alyel in Cedric's care and rush to Tarragon Peak, frantically explaining your dream to your allies. Not everyone is convinced by the visions you're having.

line.text: Have you considered that you might be heading straight into a trap?

mission.name: Welcome to Tarragon Peak?
mission.desc: Arriving in the mountains, you see a familiar face, although she doesn't seem all too happy to see you.

line.text: Oh great, another expedition come to mine and disturb our stones. Just like the bad old days.
Will someone think of the baby dragons?!

mission.name: That's Mine!
mission.desc: As Fiona warned, you see miners from all tribes scouring the rocks with their tools. They're so engrossed in their work, they don't even notice you approaching.

line.text: Look at them, taking chunks out of this sacred place and then discarding it as rubble! Makes me so angry!
Hey I was here first!
It's mine now!
Step aside! I'm going to blast this rock with my explosive bombs!
Huh, who are you? I don't recognise your... LOOK OUT! INCOMING!

mission.name: An Arcing Blaze
mission.desc: Suddenly a blast of fiery energy hits a boulder near you, luckily leaving you unscathed. You see a dragon flying overhead but far from scaring the miners, they all rush towards the ruins.

line.text: Adventurer! Are you alright? That dragon, that blaze of energy... surely my eyes were deceiving me...
Look! Over there near the blast! The rock is glowing!
*glows*
It's just like the others said!
Out of my way! Deploying mining equipment!
WHIRRRRRR!

mission.name: An Old Friend
mission.desc: Short of any useful leads, you soon realise you will need to seek clues from an old, wise, dragon.

line.text: Hey! You all back off! I saw these runes first!
SQUAWK! Not if I take the slivers before you! SQUAWK!
Tribal Discord Detected. Reporting To Base.
Huh, those mechanical drakes appear to heading towards Teroxis' summit...
Well, looks like we're going there too.

mission.name: Return of the Adventurer
mission.desc: You take the short flight up to the peak where Teroxis remains perched. The look on his face tells you that he's been expecting you.

line.text: My... friends... long time... good... see... again.
You must have... questions. Many... questions. Me... tell... all.
Well, I hope you're sitting comfortably, adventurer.

mission.name: The Invisible Hand
mission.desc: Mysterious shadows are gathered in a cave, sheltering from the void thunderclaps outside, and in animated conversation

line.text: Double, double toil and trouble. Fire burn and cauldron bubble. Scale of dragon, tooth of...
You three! Just how long did you think you were going to be able to hide this from me?! What did you do?!
Why... how... now... you sound angry?
Are you surprised?! You were supposed to investigate the source of the Void disturbance, not unleash it back into the world!
We... we... didn't anticipate the goblins would be so reckless...
Well that's another incident with the Void everyone is going to blame on the Crimsonwings.

mission.name: A Mystery Revealed
mission.desc: The mysterious figure in the cave finally reveals herself...

line.text: And you can stop acting so mysterious too, Tanit...
Sorry...
I was against the goblin idea from the start...
Good thing, however, I've been preparing these last few months for just such an eventuality...
You three better disperse back to your respective tribes before everyone starts to think we've reunited.

mission.name: The Growing Void
mission.desc: Back at Tarragon Peak, Teroxis notes that with the Titans bound to Viracocha, there was almost no resistance to the spreading Void...

line.text: She... realised... old factions... cannot fight...
Needed to find new... allies.

mission.name: Mechanical Protection
mission.desc: ... and yet these new mechanical drakes have managed to ward off the Void from his beloved mountain thus far...

line.text: Do... you like machine dragon?
Old friend... her idea... protect Peak.
Use machines... ward... Void.

mission.name: A Forgotten Fusion
mission.desc: ... and the secret energy was only to be found from a forgotten dragon long thought extinct, only for them to be rediscovered by a forgotten hero.

line.text: Also... her idea... found forgotten... Arc... dragon...
But... dragon... breath... powerful... magical... we not know...
Blaze... create magic... runes... powder... fragments... Now... all... tribes here fighting.
They damage... mountain. Me... feel sad. Hope... she return soon.
Me... waiting... Again.

mission.name: A Forgotten Tribe
mission.desc: With Teroxis' story finishing as darkness approaches, you make camp and slowly drift off into another night's sleep filled dream visions.

line.text: We are in your dreams once more.
Go find her. She has found more who were once forgotten.
Come find me. I'm waiting.
So are we.

mission.name: The Invisible Hero
mission.desc: Fresh dreams have directed you to go meet an old ally. The only issue is you have no idea where they are or where to start looking.

line.text: So there was nothing in your dreams to help us find her?

mission.name: Head Hunting
mission.desc: Fortunately, someone has overheard the commotion. Someone with experience tracking down elusive characters.

line.text: You've been having a lot of dreams recently. Have you thought about whether you should be seeking help instead?
This person you're looking for... maybe I could help?
How much of our conversation have you overheard?!
Enough to know it's someone with goggles, a spear and long curly hair...
Adventurer, have you not noticed the face on your Arena coins? Or the new Arena trophies you've been collecting? Or that statue over there on the airship?

mission.name: Hiding in Plain Sight
mission.desc: Looking at the arena coins, arena trophies and the statue watching over the gateway to the Arena, you cannot believe the answer was staring at you the entire time.

line.text: How can she be the face of the Arena?! Or any Arena? Gladius Arena was turned into a scriptorium long ago!
Well I don't know how the adventurer participates in the Arena.
All I know is I find them fast asleep in front of that statue and chests somehow appear with treasure inside.
Hold on. We went to Gladius Arena in that shared dream created by Batara. All your Arena battles must also be in the dream world...
... and Batara was one of Lev's companions. Which means...
... you're going to have take your dreams back to this Arena and find her there.
Well, I'll leave you to do whatever it is you do over there.

mission.name: Searching for Opponent...
mission.desc: You go through the familiar routine you've performed many times prior to reach the Arena. Only this time you're searching for something else...

line.text: Searching for opponent?
No? Then you've found me at last.

mission.name: So Many Questions
mission.desc: Lev stands before you in surroundings that seem both foreign and familiar. Your mind is filled with curiosity and confusion.

line.text: You must have so many questions. What is this place? Is it real? Is it Gladius Arena? How did I get here? Am I here in body as well as in mind?
I'm afraid I'm not certain of those answers myself.
But this appears to be where the Void banished all the memories and knowledge of who I once was before I defeated it.
So my face and my likeness appears in the statues, the coins, and now even the trophies from this place. And yet, this place remains forgotten and unreachable.
Unreachable except to those with a special connection to the Void. Like you. I know you've come here countless times, adventurer.
I guess I've always just been... invisible to you.

mission.name: A Living Arena
mission.desc: As Lev continues to cast away the mystery, you suddenly feel a light turn on as if you have lived through many lifetimes in this place.

line.text: Yes adventuer, you've engaged with the memories of countless adventurers in this place.
Witnessed the duels and battles. The highs and lows. The wins and losses.
Those dreams, echoes, visions... they have transcended dimensions, time, and space. All brought here by the Void.
Like you, they seem to come and go from this place as they please. I have no control except to leave a little imprint on the treasure you take from here.
Your connection to the Void is remarkable, adventurer. But I fear that alone won't be enough to defeat it this time.
Come. This way.

mission.name: The Belly of the Beast
mission.desc: You emerge from the darkness of the archway into a new but strangely familiar place. Nothing seems unusual... except for the elephant in the room.

line.text: So this is the other Void touched adventurer? I'll get ready for the briefing...

mission.name: Since You've Been Gone
mission.desc: Lev fills you in on what she's been up after you freed her from the Void.

line.text: Since we last met, I've been traveling places to understand more about Void and its power over memories.
And I quickly began to encounter more and more creatures who had abandoned their tribe or had lost a great fraction of their true nature.
I soon realised that my legacy wasn't the only one forgotten.

mission.name: A Whole Different Beast
mission.desc: It appears Lev has found new allies to turn the tide of the fight against the Void.

line.text: The Void must have erased all knowledge of this tribe for the same reasons that I was forgotten. They must have previous experience defeating the Void.
And now the Void has been released once more, they are our best hope.
Although I will admit, I was hoping I wouldn't have needed to call on them, and even then I had hoped to have more time to regain my powers and prepare.
We must act quickly. This place... it has become more unstable of late.

mission.name: Sensitive Information
mission.desc: Before you and Lev part ways, she leaves you with a word of warning.

line.text: Adventurer, you must be guarded with the information you have just received.
I believe we hold an element of surprise over the Void.
So thorough were they with the destruction of the knowledge of the Beasts, that the Void itself seems to have forgotten about their existence.
Though the thunderclouds of the Void have swirled around me, I appear to be invisible to it.
And we beasts seem to have been spared the tribal corruption.
The Void must not suspect.

mission.name: To Defeat the Void...
mission.desc: You no longer feel Lev's presence and instinctively prepare for battle as a sense of dread seizes you, until you realise you're about to receive a mission briefing.

line.text: OK, listen up, adventurer. General Karlson here.
I've seen this strategy from the Void before. Mimic the factions' traits and use it against them.
First its sows chaos and conflict, corrupting the tribes with power.
Next, it grows wild, spreading across the land. And finally it seizes control and imposes its own order from the aether.
The Void may think it has completed the first phase... but this is where we fight back!

mission.name: ... First Understand the Void
mission.desc: Through the General's briefing, you now see the Void's machinations: embody each elemental faction and in doing so... consume it.

line.text: You will meet up with us here at this time...

mission.name: The Stage is Set
mission.desc: As agreed, you go to where Karlson has chosen to mount his offensive against the Void: Elaria, where your adventures began all that time ago.

line.text: How funny that we've come full circle. Me, standing by your side to fight the Void here in Elaria.

mission.name: A Final Inspection
mission.desc: Arrayed before you is an impressive force of beasts and their commanders. Suddenly you see a familiar face.

line.text: And I want the rations to be double and triple checked!
An army marches on its stomach!
Ursurio?
Ah, so you know our quartermaster general?

mission.name: Mission Accepted
mission.desc: Your orders are simple enough: take a small force on a flanking maneuver, strike quickly, dispel the corruption, show no mercy.

mission.name: Looking for an Opening
mission.desc: You circle the enemy territory scanning for a weakness with your experienced eyes, trained from many a battle with the Void.

mission.name: Charge!
mission.desc: Seeing the perfect vulnerability, you give the order. Your allies immediately advance and go about their work, using the cleansing techniques they've learnt from Lev.

mission.name: Cleansing the Corruption
mission.desc: The corrupted voidlings are taken completely off-guard and scatter, the beasts making short work of any stragglers. You sense the corrupting Void energy already starting to dissipate.

mission.name: Maintaining Momentum
mission.desc: The voidlings are reeling from your initial assault, but the clouds swirl and concentrate further behind the lines. You realise you must not let them gather and regroup.

mission.name: A Virtuous Cycle
mission.desc: You notice the once corrupted beasts are joining the fight on your side after being cleansed. Your numbers begin to swell and you decide to press home your advantage.

mission.name: Coalescing to Victory
mission.desc: As the Void recedes, the original wildlife of the jungle sprouts back. Soon you spot another pocket of pristine jungle and realize you have joined up with the bulk of the allied forces.

line.text: Adventurer! Looks like you did more than just distract the Void!
Quite, we've had nothing but reports of unmitigated success on all fronts. Just shows you what perfect preparation can achieve!

mission.name: The Binding of the Void
mission.desc: Your forces have surrounded the strongest, angriest cloud. Shaking off an uneasy stirring in your mind, you and your allies prepare to push decisively against the Void.

line.text: This is it. The source of the darkness.
Remember your training. Stay hidden. Seek out the heart, and let the Void collapse in on itself. Use its own poison against it.

mission.name: That Was Easy...
mission.desc: With the Void in full retreat, Karlson is ready to declare victory. Lev, once forgotten, is hailed and celebrated as a savior of Elaria, a title you don't begrudge her.

line.text: We did it! Elaria is saved! The world is saved!
All hail Lev! No longer the Forgotten One! A hearty dinner for all tonight!
Something's not right. That was over too quickly.
Huh? What's going on? What are you up to?

mission.name: ... Almost Too Easy...
mission.desc: Despite the plaudits, Lev looks concerned. She appears uneasy and unhappy despite the seemingly decisive victory over the Void, all of which does not please Karlson.

line.text: I need to take a force somewhere else to investigate. This fight isn't yet over.
How? Look around you! The cloud has gone! What do you mean it's not over? The Void has been defeated!
I feel like somehow this victory was... intentional, a mere diversion. We have to stay on high alert.
Oh, I see what's going on now! Now that you're the Celebrated One, you just don't want to give up your command.
Enough. We have to find where the Void has gone.
No. We need to rebuild Elaria. We Wyld beasts won't be coming. We need to look after our own first.

mission.name: The Fellowship of Lev
mission.desc: Lev handpicks you for a small party to accompany her on a search for clues. You follow her to a place you haven't visited in a long time: Red Feather Valley.

line.text: Anyone who goes with you, Lev, is a going on a fool's errand. Look around you. The Void is no more.
Hang on, Karlson, maybe you should have more faith in her.
Heh. What do you know about faith, Ursurio? You just go where the food tastes best.

mission.name: No Fly Zone
mission.desc: You're somewhat crestfallen as Lev insists on proceeding without the airship, to avoid drawing attention. The Valley was, after all, one of the first places the Void ravaged.

line.text: No airship? But we don't have the supplies!
You, me, and the adventurer. We won't need much.
Samael, not coming along?
Not this time old friend. Even if Lev is right, the Void seems to have mostly gone. I better head back to Skyhaven and help the cleanup.
I hope that's the last I'll ever see of those demons.

mission.name: Catching Up
mission.desc: The journey is long but you find yourself passing time chatting with Ursurio about what he's been up to... in between his snacking of course!

line.text: ... and that's how I ended up as the Quartermaster General.
It was a decent posting, I guess, working with Karlson. It had its ups and downs. Mostly ups.
Still, I've never known a tusker be as opinionated about frozen foods as he was.

mission.name: Not So Desolate
mission.desc: Finally arriving in the valley, you are surprised to find it teeming with life. Nests and eggs dot the valley and avians fly overhead, all unaware of your presence.

line.text: Oh no, this isn't right...
What do you mean not right? Isn't it a good thing that this valley isn't a desolate Void wasteland?
This isn't at all what I was expecting...
Um, this might not be the right time, but is it wrong for me to be eating chicken here?

mission.name: Recovery When?
mission.desc: Did the Avians rebuild before this most recent Void scourge? Or is this all linked to the seemingly decisive victory you just won at Elaria?

mission.name: A Champion Appears
mission.desc: Before you can answer these questions, you are suddenly caught off-guard. Something has spotted you and surprised you. Luckily it seems this Avian knows Lev...

line.text: Ha! I shoulda known y'all were gonna show up right 'bout now.
Old friend. It's good to see you again. I'm sure you can probably guess why I'm here.

mission.name: The Arena Connection
mission.desc: It all makes sense to you now: why Lev has come to Red Feather Valley, and who she has come here to meet.

line.text: So why ya here with tha' there bear and that other one? I'da thought you'd be with ya Crimsons?
No. They've been dismissed. Especially after they went and delegated the original search to the goblins of all tribes.
That explains all the recent Void nonsense. I guess I got y'all to thank for clearin' it all up then?
So all this recovery is new?

mission.name: Suspicions Confirmed
mission.desc: Verus is pleased with the Valley's recent rebirth, albeit shocked by how quick the recovery has been. Somehow, this news leaves Lev uneasy.

line.text: This all makes no sense. Defeating the Void in Elaria should have had no effect here.
Why not? Happens all the time in the stories? Defeat the Big Bad and it's happily ever after!
That's why they're stories, dear General.
Maybe this here is all part of the Void's plan? Ya know, like a feint?
Wait... I see it now. Order. From the ether. The Void must have gone even further into the shadows...

mission.name: Not Yet Over
mission.desc: Lev explains her worst fear has come true: the Void is still at large but has transformed into a 'Deep Void'.

line.text: Those goblins and that blasted pocket watch. They've let the Void seep into the very fabric of time.
During my struggles with Bluefire, I had vague notions of this... 'Deep Void' but I never thought it to be more than scare tactics.

mission.name: Here, There, Everywhere
mission.desc: To prove her point, she asks you to close your eyes. You feel yourself drifting off only to awaken in the Arena! Startled, you jolt up to find yourself back on your airship!

mission.name: A Deep Sleep
mission.desc: Realising you might still be dreaming, you close your eyes again to find yourself back camped in Red Feather Valley. The fading light suggests hours must have passed.

line.text: Adventurer! Are you OK? You've been sleeping a while. Was it something you ate?
No, it's fine. This is proof the Void is still out there.

mission.name: Make Yourself at Home
mission.desc: It seems you're going to be here in this Valley for a while as your group slowly uncovers the mysteries of the Deep Void.

line.text: Well if we're going to be here for the long haul, we better get some food. I hope you don't mind if I get some chicken.
Imma be honest, big bear, I'm beginnin' to doubt if this here place is even real.
Whoa, what do you mean not real?
Verus is right. This might all be a shared dream. Or a vision. Or even a window into the past.

mission.name: Deep Mistrust
mission.desc: There's nothing quite as disconcerting as realising your whole reality might be a construct of the Deep Void. You look around your companions, not sure who or what you can trust anymore.

mission.name: Suspicious Minds
mission.desc: The Void has caught you in a trap, and you can't walk out. Will the others even believe a word you say?

line.text: Say, ya been awfully quiet about all this Deep Void stuff, adventurer.
Why don't ya speak up? Hidin' somethin'?
Easy now, Verus. The adventurer has always been the strong, silent type. Let's not pressure anyone.
Besides, it's a lot for all of us to take in.

mission.name: A Reassuring Look
mission.desc: You are thankful for Lev's intervention and catch a glimpse of her eyes. They seem to be peering into your very being, with a warmth telling you ''it'll be all fine''.

line.text: Don't mind Verus, adventurer. He means well.

mission.name: Tomorrow is Another Day
mission.desc: Your mind now at rest, you settle for the night with a determination to uncover the truth in the morning. Or perhaps even in a dream inside this apparent dream.

mission.name: Sudden Awakening
mission.desc: Your slumber is rudely interrupted by a loud crash as a mechanical flying object lands nearby, just barely missing you. Looking up, you see a swarm of similar flying machines.

line.text: Wake up! We're under attack!
Gottem!
Lev, cover me as I get the others over there!

mission.name: Gone Like a Flash
mission.desc: Instinctively, you prepare for combat when, abruptly, the machines all scatter off in every direction. Concerned and confused, you look around for the cause.

line.text: Keep those eagle eyes focussed!
Looks like it's all clear. They must have received instructions to disengage.
This day jus' keeps gettin' stranger and stranger...

mission.name: Steadfast Recall
mission.desc: You remember seeing similar flying machines in Tarragon Peak. Those belonged to Teroxis and seemingly protected the peak from the effects of the Void. Perhaps the same is true here?

mission.name: Touching the Void
mission.desc: You examine the wreckage of the crashed machine by your camp. Just as you touch a metal cog, a vision suddenly appears. It seems to be able to read and answer your own thoughts.

line.text: Yes, this machine was following my instructions.
You can all chase these Mecha instead of chasing Void shadows.
Don't keep making the same mistakes.
Stop trying to eradicate the Void. The Void is...
... essential.

mission.name: An Old Trick of the Mind
mission.desc: The machines were messenger vessels for none other than Viracocha! Your mind is brimming with questions, all of which the Titan preempts... not unlike how Lev used to do it.

line.text: Yes. This place is... artificial. It was created.
Is it real? Depends on your definition of reality. Your companions are all sharing in this same ''reality''.
Did the Void create this? Yes and no.
Like every other tribe, the Mecha felt the return of the Void. But so did the Factions and the Titans.
Together, we all helped in our own way to create what you are currently seeing and experiencing.
Adventurer! I assume you've heard the same things as we all have!

mission.name: Deep Dive into the Void
mission.desc: A long philosophical discussion on the ontological nature and metaphysics of the Void with a mechanical Titan was certainly not on your to do list at the start of the day!

line.text: I once too thought that the absence of the Factions was the Void. I was wrong.
The Void is not the absence of Aether, Chaos, Wyld. That is just... absence.
The Void cannot be destroyed, only contained.
Annihilating the Void would only bring imbalance.

mission.name: Power Imbalance
mission.desc: The message from Viracocha is a warning: do not attempt to annihilate the Void. Anything that can defeat the Void would itself need to be defeated. Thus starting a neverending cycle of power.

line.text: You're wrong Titan! The Void is the imbalance.
It is insiduous and grows its power through corruption. Whatever defeats it does not have to share those qualities.
Spoken like a Factional hero, who's been gaining her power recently.

mission.name: More Suspicious Minds
mission.desc: All the revelations have not allayed any suspicions, and only seems to have undermined whatever shared reality or dream you are all currently experiencing.

line.text: I don't believe a word that Titan says. He might be corrupted by the Void for all we know.
I'mma be honest, Lev. I don't think we can go on together.
Verus, we're meant to be all in this together!
Sure, but if this here is some shared dream reality... we ain't buildin' on a foundation of suspicion.
Y'all take care now.

mission.name: Where Did You Go?
mission.desc: You're not quite sure how Verus departed from this artificial reality and there's no way of asking him now. Unfortunately, you now have other problems. Undead problems.

line.text: GRAARRROOOoooooowww!

mission.name: I've Been Here Long Time Ago
mission.desc: You, Lev and Ursurio make quick work of the skeletons. Standing behind them, though, is a familiar sight...

mission.name: Which Witch?
mission.desc: Aria! You're not sure though if it's really her or a creation of the Void. After all, she was one of the first to be possessed by the Void.

mission.name: Treasure Hunter... Again
mission.desc: Aria explains why she is here. You are beginning to find this conversation oddly familiar, almost as if you've heard it before.

line.text: The glyphs spoke of an ancient power sealed away here. If I could just get my hands on it...
This feels like a story from years ago you've told me about before, Aria.
Don't you look at me like that.

mission.name: Another Path to Knowledge
mission.desc: Aria turns and flees. Your group chases her. You can see a monument in the distance.

line.text: Yup, you've definitely told me this story before.
If only I could remember what happens next...

mission.name: Breaking Free One More Time
mission.desc: As you approach the monument, the ground shatters around your feet. Void shadows rise from the ground and start attacking.

line.text: The shadows?! They are moving!
What are these things?! I've never seen anything like them!
Oh yeah, that's what happens next!

mission.name: Aria's Second Flight
mission.desc: Aria tries to flee the valley but cannot outrun the Voidlings. Unable to find sanctuary, she summons as many Undead as she can to fight them off.

line.text: I think she's trying to find a temple!
No! Get out of my mind!
Who are you? Where am I?! STAY AWAY!

mission.name: Seized by Darkness
mission.desc: The Voidlings have now surrounded Aria. With a scream, the shadows consume her. The skeletons, now without their master, turn and attack you!

mission.name: Push the Undead Back
mission.desc: More Undead come from the woods but these are different. A poisonous corruption swirls around them. You turn to your party with a knowing nod.

mission.name: Return of the Necromancer
mission.desc: You spot a cloaked figure that appears to be the leader. As you approach, she removes her hood and you see a familiar face.

line.text: Does it feel like we are fighting the same thing again and again?
So you're the ones who have defeated my precious minions? I shall add you to my collection!!

mission.name: Standing Down?
mission.desc: Just as you are about to rush in, you feel a tug on your back. You turn around and see Lev. Maybe this isn't a battle you are meant to fight.

line.text: Adventurer! Stop! This feels like a trap.
Maybe that Mecha was right and we shouldn't be always seeking to defeat the Void. Perhaps this is a fight we should back down from.
You said that this necromancer was your first contact with the Void?
That's interesting. For you see, Verus was there for my first.

mission.name: The Void Puppetmaster
mission.desc: Aria was to you what Verus was to Lev: there at your earliest encounter with the Void. You wonder who else this reality will materialize from your past.

line.text: All these Undead, the necromancer, even Verus. They must have just been creations of the Deep Void.
We have to be careful. I believe the Void is now burrowed deep into our memories, insidiously replaying them back to us.
Ursurio! You're the only one whose memories have yet to be dredged up. Can you remember your first time?
Mmmm... tasty honey.

mission.name: Honey Boo Boo
mission.desc: You hear the buzz of the approaching swarm growing in volume long before you see the silhouettes against the sky...

line.text: Really, Ursurio? A Void tainted pot of honey? That was your first contact with the Void?

mission.name: Not the Bees
mission.desc: You deduce these insects had something to do with Ursurio's first encounter with the Void. In retrospect, you probably should have guessed it was food related.

line.text: The bees were smaller the first time round!
And it's not like I knew they were bringing Void pollen back to their honeycombs!

mission.name: Bring Back Our Honey
mission.desc: You have plenty of questions for Ursurio but they will have to wait whilst you take care of the bugs.

mission.name: Stinging a Bear's Back
mission.desc: Ursurio doesn't seem to mind the bees attacking. Presumably his thick hide and armor provide protection against their stings.

line.text: And I have a strong stomach!
It was just mild food poisoning...
... and maybe a few hallucinations.

mission.name: If I Only Had Honey
mission.desc: In the midst of the fighting, Ursurio tries to justify eating the Void infected honey, bemoaning his inability to find anything quite like it again.

line.text: Wait, if we follow these critters back to their nest, maybe I'll find that honey again!
Focus!

mission.name: Long Term Poisoning
mission.desc: The three of you remaining in the group beat the swarm into retreat, but Lev wonders if there were long term consequences for Ursurio from that day.

line.text: You seemed to be taking those stings quite well, Ursurio, considering you dived right into the thick of it.
Are you sure you didn't get long term side effects from the Void, what with being mildly poisoned?
Now that you mention it, I have always felt quite immune from the Void corruption. Hmmm... never thought of it like that.

mission.name: Dinner Time
mission.desc: All this fighting and talk of honey has made your group hungry. You make your way back to camp and your rations.

line.text: All this talk has made me hungry. Let's get back to --
Watch your step, General!
Thing nearly tripped me over! What was that?
BZZZT... WHRR...

mission.name: Return of the Messenger
mission.desc: With all the excitement of the insect attack, your group failed to notice the wreckage of another flying machine, similar to those you saw previously.

line.text: Looks like one of that Mecha Titan's messenger vessels.
I guess he has another message for us.

mission.name: Viracocha's Accusations
mission.desc: Viracocha once again speaks directly into your mind, but more forceful and accusatory than before.

line.text: Poison, Lev? That's rich of you saying the bear is carrying Poison.
Have you ever checked the tip of your spear? Or have you been so preoccupied not to even notice?
That's right, Lev. Poison. Interesting how you didn't used to do that. Looks like the Void has changed you...

mission.name: Lev, the Poisoner
mission.desc: Viracocha is accusing Lev of being the source of the Void corruption!

line.text: What are you trying to achieve with these baseless accusations?
The truth. Isn't that what we all want?

mission.name: Trapped Again?
mission.desc: These are serious allegations against Lev! But even more serious is Viracocha's plan to deal with her...

line.text: Was this the plan all along? Create this place and then trap me here.
Well I think I know who the Void has actually corrupted.

mission.name: All Part of a Plan
mission.desc: Meanwhile, somewhere unbeknowst to you all...

line.text: It's all going perfectly according to plan...

mission.name: It's Time to Go
mission.desc: Viracocha's accusations cannot go unanswered. Lev glances your way and without saying a word, you immediately comprehend. The time has come for the Celebrated Hero to confront the Mechanical Titan.

line.text: Let's get going. Ursurio! Don't forget the rations!
Ha! As if there's any chance of that.

mission.name: Better Than Revenge
mission.desc: Lev is not just out to clear her name or seek revenge. She is convinced the Titan will lead her to the source of the Deep Void.

line.text: It all makes sense now. Viracocha bound the Titans.
Now, it wants to bind you.
I will not be trapped by the Void again.

mission.name: I Can See You
mission.desc: You notice familiar machines are tracking your group. Lev sees them also, turns and gives chase, almost certain these flying scouts will lead her to Viracocha.

line.text: BZZZT... WHRR...
Lev, this could be a trap...
Trap or not, I need answers.

mission.name: Out of the Woods
mission.desc: Your group follows the machines through the trees and into a clearing. There is a feeling of crackling energy in the air. You look to Ursurio and Lev. A knowing nod suggests they sense it too.

line.text: AWOOO!

mission.name: Everything Has Changed
mission.desc: Lev has noticed the wolves around here are coursing with the mythical effects of the Titans. Something must have disrupted the balance to unleash such elemental power.

line.text: Uh... Lev... I've got a bad feelin--
Foolish one! You think you can challenge me in my domain?

mission.name: Bigger Than the Whole Sky
mission.desc: Viracocha suddenly looms into view, more immense than you even remember. You dimly perceive the presence of the other Titans. Before you can even react, you are hit by a wave of unbound elemental energy.

line.text: Watch ou--

mission.name: Eyes Open
mission.desc: You wake abruptly, the light through the portholes of your airship dazzling your eyes. The last thing you remember is exploring Red Feather Valley. You are alone and the silence feels ominous.

mission.name: You Need to Calm Down
mission.desc: You're not quite sure how or why you've ended up back on your airship. You search for any sign of your companions. A slight sense of panic begins to set in.

mission.name: You're on Your Own, Kid
mission.desc: You head up to the bridge and scan the horizon. The vast expanse of Red Feather Valley stretches out below, untouched by the Void.

mission.name: No Body, No Crime
mission.desc: You continue to search for any sign of activity, but see nothing. No used campsites, no debris, no signs of battle. Other than the avian nests, Red Feather Valley is pristine.

mission.name: Epiphany
mission.desc: You recall that you originally came on foot, not by airship, and waking up here instead last time was proof of a constructed reality. Are you dead? Did Lev protect you? Or has the Void sent you deeper into a separate reality?

mission.name: Mastermind
mission.desc: Little did you know, that for all of Lev's efforts rallying the Beast tribe, the Void had moved first through the factional Elementals. Though known for subjugation, the Void is perfectly adept at infiltration...

line.text: Ha ha ha. Too easy.
How about we trade places and you come inside this purple stone?
No, that's your punishment for choosing such an obvious alias. Viir?!
Viracocha... Viir!! I'm amazed no one has noticed yet.

mission.name: Cleanup Complete
mission.desc: Meanwhile, Samael and Yuriel proudly gaze from afar at Skyhaven. The citadel is gleaming once again after the demonic invasion.

line.text: It'll take another few months before we reorganize all the books in the Grand Library.
At least the rugs are all clean again.

mission.name: Two Plus One
mission.desc: The two old Aether friends have traveled here with Gobtoh, the mischievous angelic Goblin whose actions caused all the mayhem.

line.text: How was I supposed to know those weapons would release a horde of demons into our home?
Well now you know, little goblin. You unleashed chaos.
Void, Samael. He unleashed the Void.

mission.name: The Shackled Trickster
mission.desc: Gobtoh, bound by celestial chains, scowls at his captors. Samael is unimpressed by the lack of cooperation.

line.text: Can I go home now? I don't like it here.

mission.name: Supply Chains
mission.desc: Samael continues with his interrogation, intent on discovering how Gobtoh came into possession of Remi's Void weapons.

line.text: You have much to answer for!
The court will show leniency if you tell us who supplied you with those weapons. Tell us!
TELL US! UNLESS YOU WANT TO BE PUT BACK INTO A STONE!

mission.name: Incriminating Evidence
mission.desc: Yuriel produces a single red feather, tucked like a bookmark in his tome. It would appear this is the reason they are all here in Red Feather Valley.

line.text: Maybe this will jog your memory. We found this on your person when Melkira first trapped you.
So that's why we're here? Because of one red feather?
Hahaha! You are looking in precisely the wrong direction!
Oh, so not the birds in the sky but the beasts on the ground?
Err... I never said that!
You didn't have to.

mission.name: Beasts of a Feather
mission.desc: Gobtoh reveals his source was neither Remi nor an Avian resident of the valley. It was in fact a Beast...

line.text: This makes no sense. Lev had united the Beasts against the Void.
Yes, but it would be naive to assume that there wasn't a single Beast corrupted by the Void.

mission.name: To Do List
mission.desc: Samael and Yuriel continue their quest to tie up all remaining loose ends from the Goblin Civil War.

mission.name: Running to Time
mission.desc: The angels are on the the hunt for Remi's pocket watch, and its last known owner: Xerkahn.

mission.name: Berserk Angel
mission.desc: Samael has good reason to want to find the watch, namely one very angry joint queen of Skyhaven.

line.text: Have you heard from Alyel recently?
The frog healers assure me that they've done the best they can. She hasn't been able to get her speed back, but is perfectly healthy otherwise.

mission.name: A Beast in Disguise?
mission.desc: Yuriel ponders all the clues they have encountered thus far. He arrives at theory that Xerkahn is an imposter.

line.text: It seems obvious to me that Xerkahn is a Beast in disguise.
As if Beasts know how to use magic. *She'd* probably be the one disguised as a Beast.
Who said anything about magic? So it *is* a magic disguise just like your masquerade as Reks!
Wait... you can't use that! I plead self-incrimination!

mission.name: Finding an Imposter
mission.desc: Gobtoh scoffs at Yuriel. Even armed with that knowledge, surely there's no way to track Xerkahn down.

line.text: Well it's not like you'll ever find her!
You underestimate our ability to spread more rumors amongst the Goblins.
What's the Void weapon equivalent of a honeypot?

mission.name: Sailed into a Trap
mission.desc: Suddenly, a familiar ship appears through the clouds. It would appear Samael's plan has worked.

line.text: Arrrrrright yer meddlin' Angels! Hand over the watch yer stole from me!
What a shame! It appears your information was inaccurate!

mission.name: Fool Me Once
mission.desc: Xerkahn has followed Samael and Yuriel into Red Feather Valley, tricked into thinking they were in possession of Remi's pocket watch.

mission.name: Can't Fool Me Twice
mission.desc: However, Xerkahn hasn't sailed into the Aether duo's trap without reinforcements.

line.text: I brought somethin' just in case yer angels were tryin' to dupe ol' Xerkahn!
Red Goblin Leader standing by!

mission.name: Boom! Boom! Boom!
mission.desc: Xerkahn's air support opens with a barrage of goblin explosives -- much to no one's surprise, especially Yuriel.

line.text: BOMBS AWAY!
Deploy the acid flasks!

mission.name: Acid Test
mission.desc: Yuriel had come prepared to deal with Xerkahn and her usual salvo of bombs... but acid flasks? That's a whole different kettle of fish.

line.text: Acid flasks?! Where did the goblins get all of these from?
They must have been hoarding them.

mission.name: Melted into Air
mission.desc: The angels weave and bob around the flying bombs. One flask narrowly misses and lands into a pile of red feathers, rapidly dissolving them away.

line.text: Watch out!
Nooooo! My red feathers!! I was going to trade them for coins when I get back to Skyhaven!
Silence, Gobtoh! We're under attack!
Cover me! I'm going for the flagship.

mission.name: The Best Defense
mission.desc: Samael sees an opening and charges in to attack Xerkahn's flagship... but the goblins have a stinging surprise!

line.text: Enemy angel incoming!
Deploy the acid shield!
Ugh! Even my celestial sword is being corroded!

mission.name: The Great Escape...
mission.desc: Seeing his captors distracted from all the commotion, Gobtoh suddenly realises a way to free himself from his celestial shackles.

line.text: Wait, it works on celestial weapons?
Hey T... I mean Xerkahn, throw the acid over here and dissolve my chains!
Wait? What did you say?

mission.name: ... No Escape
mission.desc: Samael and Yuriel regroup. They can't risk Gobtoh escaping. The angels were beaten but not defeated.

mission.name: Follow the Acid Trail
mission.desc: It's clear to all that the key to defeating the goblins is to understand how Xerkahn got hold of the corrosive liquid.

line.text: ... everything that was previously in those flasks would have decayed away by now, Yuriel...
... that doesn't disprove my theory this is the goblins' own work and not a Void weapon...

mission.name: A Precious Shard
mission.desc: Yuriel carefully reveals a fragment of flask that he took for inspection and further investigation.

line.text: ... good thing I saved this piece of flask here as evidence. We can do more tests when we're back in Skyhaven...
Are you two still debating this? Can you both stop and let me get some sleep?
Quiet, Gobtoh! The grown ups are having an important chat.
Ugh, you angels are so full of yourselves. Can't possibly fathom that goblins could come up with acid rain by themselves.
Wait, earlier, you almost called Xerkahn by a different name. Beginning with T... so that's the name of the Xerkahn imposter...
Errrr, no I didn't. I plead no self-incrimination!

mission.name: Unveiling the Imposter
mission.desc: Gobtoh gave the pair another clue earlier... a goblin beginning with the letter T. Luckily, there's a diligent archivist at hand to look this up.

line.text: Let me look this up in my notes... bear with...
You know what they say about using honey instead of vinegar to catch flies...
Hmmm, maybe this T... no... can't be... maybe... wait...
... no that's a title... this one doesn't seem likely... hang on... what if...
Aha! Here it is. Dark Mage Tagati. I think we found our magical goblin.

mission.name: Revealed!
mission.desc: Dark Mage Tagati! No? That's OK. Samael had not heard of her either.

line.text: Who?
So disrespectful! All we ever wanted was respect!

mission.name: No Allies Here
mission.desc: Now that the supposed Goblin King has been unmasked as an imposter, you hoped his followers would lay down their weapons or turn on their false king. How wrong you were. It's almost as if the goblins were simply itching for a war.

mission.name: Which Witch is Which?
mission.desc: You begin to uncover how Gobtoh maintained his deception: dark magic powered by witches and mages that Gobtoh gathered in his entourage. You make a beeline for the concentration of arcane energy.

mission.name: Vengeful Demons
mission.desc: Seeing your strategy, Gobtoh attempts to outflank you. Caught off guard you have no choice but to brace for his counterattack!

mission.name: A Fateful Encounter
mission.desc: As luck would have it, amidst the chaos and fog of war, you find Gobtoh separated from his army and cornered. You understand now is your best chance to defeat him once and for all.

mission.name: Betrayal!
mission.desc: Just as you are about to deliver a finishing below to Gobtoh, your swing is broken by a spear. A spear belonging to the goblin centurion!

line.text: I'm sorry but I can't let you do that.

mission.name: A Final Twist
mission.desc: Gobtoh has escaped! You and your allies turn on the Centurion, furious at his treachery. Yet he remains stoic, almost as if he had a good reason to stop you.

line.text: Sivun is working for Gobtoh, not Boldur. And Sivun attacked you before Gobtoh, disguised as false Reks, even checked your ship for any of Nophora's weapons.
That means Gobtoh must know where the real cache is hidden. You can't smite him now, adventurer. You need him to lead you to the weapons!

mission.name: Portrait of the Apocalypse
mission.desc: You are having a dream. Ominous purple cracks spread across Arcantica, and a bubbling rainbow of chaotic possibilities bleeds out from within them.

mission.name: Primordial Riverbed
mission.desc: The world drowns in those infinite colors, and then the universe. Then, the waters still. Everything gives way to ominous black. Not even the stars are visible.

mission.name: In the Darkness
mission.desc: You cannot perceive anymore. And yet, you can hear a voice call out to you. The whispering is oddly familiar to you... and so is the harsh presence all around you.

line.text: ...come with us! Come with us! Come with us!

mission.name: The Void Unbound
mission.desc: Voidlings usher you mindlessly through the shadows. A million purple eyes open. The presence clawing at your sanity is the all-encompassing darkness.

line.text: We meet again...
In many shapes...
In many faces...
Thy quest continues...
But all in vain...
This world begins and ends in nothing...
And through nothing...
We have unlimited potential.

mission.name: Dream No More
mission.desc: You raise your blade and your Spellstones in defiance against the protean Void. The voices taunt you, but you keep what is left of your wits and battle on!

line.text: Thy heart. Thy soul. Thy spirit.
All flowing... into one single stream.

mission.name: To a World Rewritten
mission.desc: As you flail around uselessly, you sense the Void bore of this fight. The very air pulses with rage. The more you fight, the more your head throbs. Soon you fall into a vast black sleep, and you know no more.

line.text: Go, our Champion.
Return... from whence thou came...

mission.name: Celebrating Year 1
mission.desc: It's Spellstone's 8th anniversary and we definitely remembered. Definitely nothing last minute about this celebration.

line.text: SQUAK! It's Spellstone's 8th anniversary! Did you remember to invite the party Titans?
