Oh hey there. We and the other Titans heard there was a celebration party.
It certainly has been a very eventful year hasn't it?
But let's not dwell on the past. Time to celebrate and look ahead to another year!

mission.name: Celebrating Year 2
mission.desc: It's Spellstone's 8th anniversary and time to start the celebration with an old classic.

line.text: The Vengeance buff is coming! And everybody's jumping!
Wait, you don't even have Vengenace.
I hope he knows it's just a joke...

mission.name: Celebrating Year 3
mission.desc: It's Spellstone's 8th anniversary and the DJ is blasting out tunes. Except that everyone probably has the music muted.

line.text: What's the name of this song?

mission.name: Celebrating Year 4
mission.desc: It's Spellstone's 8th anniversary and new party guests have arrived.

line.text: So y'all having a party and didn't invite the other Mythics?
Look! I wasted 500 gold buying you as an egg before I knew what it was for!
SQUAK! Technically it was the goblin merchant that swindled you.
Hey! This is a celebration not a feedback session!

mission.name: Celebrating Year 5
mission.desc: It's Spellstone's 8th anniversary and a queen is doing her own little thing.

line.text: If you liked it then you shoulda put a rune on it!
Don't be mad once you see others have Health on it
People put a rune on me way before you though...

mission.name: Celebrating Year 6
mission.desc: It's Spellstone's 8th anniversary and we are celebrating all our successes and victories.

line.text: We are the champions, my friends...
Um, we're mythics, not champions.
... Speak for yourself!
And we'll keep on fighting til the end...
OK, that's definitely not true in your case

mission.name: Celebrating Year 7
mission.desc: It's Spellstone's 8th anniversary and things are getting animated. Reanimated even.

line.text: I fell in to a burning ring of fire... Went down, down, down, and the flames went higher...
And it burns, burns, burns... the ring of fire, the ring of fire!
Yeah, but I hit skip so you don't catch fire for me.

mission.name: Celebrating Year 8
mission.desc: It's Spellstone's 8th anniversary and it' time to finish this mastery level and get an amazing reward!

line.text: Wait, is that?
... for real?
So the rumors were true!
It has to be!
It's so shiny!
I cannot wait to see his skills!

mission.name: A New Tide Swells...
mission.desc: Though a bitter memory now, King Proteus remembers the days when Scylla and Typhoeus, the terrible sea serpents, were worshipped like deities. His own mother led the flock.

mission.name: A New Wave Crashes...
mission.desc: Queen Tethys had mastered elemental magic, using her control over the flow of the ocean to confuse and rend asunder even mighty Blackfins as offerings.

mission.name: A New Thunder Rolls...
mission.desc: The Void, in its liquid form, spread through the oceans faster than any disease. In desperation, Tethys stoked Scylla and Typhoeus' storming rages to bless the sea.

mission.name: A New Lightning Flashes...
mission.desc: Perhaps her prayers were answered when a human child, tempest-tossed, washed up in her cradle on the island of the Rhynio. That baby girl would soon grow to become Lev, the Crimson Hero.

mission.name: The Serpent Reborn Anew...
mission.desc: When Proteus assumed the throne, he had other plans for the Pharos Ocean. Where Tethys saw the lightning of Chaos, Proteus' Wyld heart wept at the sight of Scylla's anger.

mission.name: Face the Maelstrom's Fury!
mission.desc: Some say the serpents truly do carry blessings. Some say they are creatures best forgotten by history. But who can reckon with them? Who comprehends the maelstrom's fury?

mission.name: Whom the Angels Named Malchior
mission.desc: Once upon a midnight dreary, Malchior pondered, weak and weary, over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore.

line.text: And to think there's so much more!

mission.name: This Mystery Explore
mission.desc: While he nodded, nearly napping, suddenly there came a tapping, as of some one gently rapping, rapping at the hermit's door.

line.text: Tis the wind, and nothing more!

mission.name: Bird or Devil?
mission.desc: Open here he flung the shutter, when, with many a flirt and flutter, in there stepped a stately Raven of the saintly highest heaven.

line.text: Darkness there, and nothing mo--
Who the heck are you?!

mission.name: Quoth Eleven, Evermore
mission.desc: Then, he thought, the air grew denser, perfumed from an unseen censer. Swung by Seraphim...... Quoth the Raven thus: 'Eleven!'

line.text: Wretch!
By these angels he hath sent thee...
SQUAWK!
Eleven! Eleven!
Error Code 11 - Please restart Spellstone

mission.name: Demon of Pride
mission.desc: You shall not pass!

mission.name: Demon of Greed
mission.desc: You shall not pass!

mission.name: Demon of Anger
mission.desc: You shall not pass!

mission.name: Demon of Envy
mission.desc: You shall not pass!

mission.name: Demon of Gluttony
mission.desc: You shall not pass!

mission.name: Demon of Sloth
mission.desc: You shall not pass!

mission.name: The First Day of Krampus
mission.desc: This holiday season, Krampus is atoning for the attempt theft of all the presents last year. But on the first day of Krampus trying to make amends...

line.text: Where did the pear tree go? I swear there used to be a whole orchard here.
Um... I have been chopping a lot of trees over the holiday season.
What about the partridges?
They must have all been eaten by now!
The only ones left will be the undead ones. Pesky things to cook those undead partridges. Even skeletons can get food poisoning you know.

mission.name: The Second Day of Krampus
mission.desc: Undeterred by the lack of partridges or pear trees, Krampus goes in search of a pair of turtle doves.

line.text: Why are you asking me about birds? You've come to the wrong tribe!
I thought turtles lived in the sea.
Turtle doves aren't turtles!

mission.name: The Third Day of Krampus
mission.desc: Still lacking any gifts, Krampus goes in search of the next item on his list.

line.text: Why would I know anything about French hens?!
But I thought all frogs were French?
Well, consider me offended. You get nothing! You lose! Good day, sir!

mission.name: The Fourth Day of Krampus
mission.desc: Despite once again having no gifts to show for his effort, Krampus feels confident today is the day. Surely, he thinks, calling birds are easy to find.

line.text: Who are you implying is a calling bird?!
I'm not calling you anything...
CALLING! There you go again!

mission.name: The Fifth Day of Krampus
mission.desc: Krampus looks at his list and sees: OOOOOps. He is momentarily confused before he remembers what that means.

line.text: Golden rings! Five of them!
These rings are actually brass not gold.
Surely you can spare some!
Well no, I need them for critical repairs and my name is Scyer, not Shirley.

mission.name: The Sixth Day of Krampus
mission.desc: Although, Krampus cannot remember why he decided to gift a half dozen eggs, he knows where to find the best ones.

line.text: *checking list twice*
Oh no... it isn't six eggs but six creatures laying eggs I need...
Hands off those eggs! I paid a lot of gold for those and I'm still waiting for them to hatch!

mission.name: The Seventh Day of Krampus
mission.desc: Today Krampus starts the day researching what a swan is, having never seen on in the flesh.

line.text: So it says here that swans have big white wings and are known for fierce temperament and aggressive behavior.
Don't even think about it, Krampus...

mission.name: The Eighth Day of Krampus
mission.desc: By now, a week into this futile mission, Krampus is starting to wonder who came up with the idea of gifting milk maids.

line.text: Where am I going to find a milking maid when there are no beasts anywhere?
Who are you calling a beast?

mission.name: The Ninth Day of Krampus
mission.desc: Mrs. Krampus and her friends were never a fan of dancing, so once again Krampus has to find his gift idea elsewhere.

line.text: Ah yes, dancing labybugs. You aren't the first to have requested that this time of year.
So you're saying I can get nine ladies dancing?!
I'm afraid they are all busy. Ms. Tilly and her Muddy Buddies have many fans, and you aren't the only one. We could put you on a waiting list?
On second thoughts, perhaps best not. Mrs. Krampus wouldn't be best pleased.

mission.name: The Tenth Day of Krampus
mission.desc: Finally, Krampus catches a break and encounters actual Lords, ten Lava Lords even. Unfortunately, there is one small detail Krampus has overlooked.

line.text: Oh. Leap, you say? I'm afraid we don't have legs to do that.

mission.name: The Eleventh Day of Krampus
mission.desc: Having visited a different tribe on each of the ten days thus far, Krampus finally visits his fellow goblins in Gobsburg, where he knows for certain there are pipers.

line.text: I know there are pipers in Gobsburg! They've got feathered caps. Three delay. They've got heal all, weaken all and vengeance.
Well, unfortunately the people of Gobsburg didn't pay them after they solved their bug problem, so they took their vengeance.
Funny you ask about eleven pipers because they did indeed lead the townsfolk to the cave of eleven and were never seen again...
The curse of 11...

mission.name: The Twelfth Day of Krampus
mission.desc: Feeling defeated and without anything on his list, Krampus heads home. However, in the corner of his eye, he suddenly spies what appears to be twelve drummers...

line.text: Is that? Twelve? Twelve drummers drumming? Finally! After twelve days...
Whoa... what are you doing here?
Hang on, these are your drummers?
They aren't drummers. These are my craftsmen who are beating these stones into dust and powder.
Ah yes, it wouldn't be the holidays without lots of white powder.
Quite... let's just say this is one of my best sellers so how about I give you some of this powder and we be on our way?

mission.name: Epics are Blue
mission.desc: The enemy is only using Epics, maybe you should too?

mission.name: Bluefire is Blue
mission.desc: You're so special, he gave his heart to you.

mission.name: Bluefire is Still Blue
mission.desc: If I had any flasks, I'd use them on you.

mission.name: Solaron is Blue
mission.desc: No one can compare to the Radiance of you.

mission.name: Atlas is Green
mission.desc: You Invigorate me even more than caffeine.

mission.name: Vulcanos is Red
mission.desc: Your morning Scorchbreath smells worse than Undead.

mission.name: The Oops Screen is Black
mission.desc: We're really sorry if you ever lost an attack.

mission.name: Violets are Blue
mission.desc: From all of us in ComDev, we'd like to thank you.

mission.name: The Truth is Out There
mission.desc: The investigative tusker Karlson believes he's found secret ComDev emails that were leaked to him by an inside source. This April, he's going to tell everyone what's coming up in Spellstone.

line.text: I also discovered all their story ideas.
And what they plan to do is make you read the story.
That's right. Lots of dialog.
Really annoying dialog.
And then you're going to be tested on it.
Just like in school.
Is this getting annoying yet?
No?
I bet it is.
Get used to it.
You're going to have to earn these free rewards.
OK, last dialog.
I promise.
No really.
Fine. I can sense this joke is getting old.
Maybe I'll have more to say next mission...

mission.name: Buff to Freeze!
mission.desc: Freeze All on 0 Delay cards! Clarification on how Freeze targeting really works!

line.text: Freeze All? Doesn't affect me then.
Buffs to Barrage!
OK, I need Invisibility 99!
I knew it! My Freeze always targets the right card when I'm in the enemy deck.
And it always targets the tower or an Invisible card when I'm in your deck!

mission.name: New Runes!
mission.desc: New Legendary Runes for Freeze, Dualstrike and Emberhide! Now with extra Health!

line.text: I agree with a Freeze rune!
Dualstrike every 1!
Dualstrike every 1!
Ahem. Where's my Heartseeker rune?

mission.name: Daze Rework!
mission.desc: Daze will be reworked! Whichever player has the card with the highest Daze value will cause the other player to...

line.text: Oops! Something expected happened!

mission.name: Common Get Some!!
mission.desc: HUGE Buffs to Common Cards!! Extra stars in Challenges for using only Commons! Get 138 out of 135 challenge stars!!

line.text: I'm going to be buffed like Oxylus!

mission.name: New Arena BGE!!
mission.desc: No more +2 delay!! Instead, Deathtouch!! Also no duplicates of any card!!

line.text: Oh yeah! I love Deathtouch!
No duplicates?! How are people going to play spam decks now?!
Doesn't matter for enemies. I've still got 15 Wolpers waiting for you in this node!
Sorry, this node is using the Common BGE. We didn't turn Deathtouch on.
Wait... I need to change my deck...

mission.name: Champion Ascension!!
mission.desc: Every other game seems to do this: sacrifice all your Champion Levels for a boost and a chance to repurchase all the stones again!!

line.text: My ascended version better take my delay back to 0!
We're never going to do this though, right?
Right?

mission.name: Guild War Matchmaking!!
mission.desc: Streamlined matchmaking for Guild War!! Top two guilds face each other nine times!! All other guilds fighting for third place!!

line.text: There are rumors that Guild Wars will be replaced altogether by just the Guild War Placements.
Oh and guild sizes being reduced down to 5.

mission.name: Artwork Tweaks!!!
mission.desc: To match the Kongregate website design, all artwork will be slightly off center by about 20 pixels!!!

line.text: Does this mean my Champion card portrait size is getting fixed in Steam?
Let's say... maybe?

mission.name: Account Security!!!
mission.desc: All accounts will require full identity confirmation to ensure every player is genuine and unique!!!

line.text: For even more security, the next step is to require you to stream the game whilst you play.

mission.name: Spellstone: Idle Game!!!
mission.desc: Full Autoplay! New quality of life setting to automatically find your strongest deck and autoplay all your challenges, events and Arena!!!

line.text: Full automation? Cool, so it's almost like you're a bo---
Don't say that word!
Besides, the correct word is Mecha.

mission.name: Spellstone 2: Match 3 Boogaloo!!!
mission.desc: A sequel to Spellstone cashing in on the Match 3 craze with the Spellstone simulator as an unlockable mini game!!!1!!!

line.text: OK, I'll admit that my source for all this information probably wasn't very reliable.
It was probably all made up.
Like the reasons I have such an odd skill set.
And this dialog. I bet you're hoping I won't keep---
Error! Too much squawking!

mission.name: Helvius, Spraying Mantis
mission.desc: Let me be your guide through the last year of new champions. Our community development began with a forgotten hero of the Rhynio insects. It recently learnt how to spray lots of poison!

mission.name: Sivun, the Blind Commander
mission.desc: Next we saw... well he couldn't see us because his brother stole his eyes. Just be glad we couldn't find art to create Nommocnu Seilla.

mission.name: K'luum, the Unbound Void
mission.desc: Ah yes, the Big Bad released from Remi's pocket watch. Also known as Heidi or Angry Cloud, this primordial cloud of gas is, ironically, not a fan of Steam.

mission.name: Tethys, the Watershaper
mission.desc: We then met the old Queen of Pharos. Her *rain* of terror began as the seas ran black with Void, and the Seafolk thought they could Mark like Avian.

mission.name: Archangel Melkira
mission.desc: When Skyhaven was overrun with demons, from the gods came this underestimated angel. He was guided by a simple maxim: Trust no one. Question everything.

mission.name: Daffdal, the Lamp Keeper
mission.desc: Be careful what you wish for with this tanky frog and his ancient lamp. Those wishing the frogs could throw bombs like the goblins, found themselves hexed by their tongues.

mission.name: Yanlong, the Matron
mission.desc: Once in Tarragon Peak, stood a boiling pool of magma. Where a fiery red dragon laid her babies, in the lava for a bed.

mission.name: Arezzo, the Chimera
mission.desc: Part Dragon, part Beast. Its form exudes arcane power, evoking awe and trepidation. Its symphony of roars marked the arrival of a brand new tribe!

mission.name: General Karlson
mission.desc: A veteran of past battles with the Void, and survivor of much crossfire, this tusker now spends his time mulling on theories of the Void. Maybe he'll have more to say next month...

mission.name: Little Kawosha
mission.desc: This little owl had big dreams and even bigger naps. Though his sleepiness and small size made him a poor steward of the Grand Library, he made for a pint sized hex bolt terror.

mission.name: Scrap, the Acorn Seeker
mission.desc: You might not expect to find Mecha in Red Feather Valley. But one clever squirrel, who knew how to dive into the dungeons, learnt the advantages of having a metal body.

mission.name: Milax, Guardian of the Shade
mission.desc: All living things can become undead, even plants. Though where this lies between the arboreal and vampiric creature is anyone's guess. But I personally think it could be better dressed.

mission.name: Ecyxigua, the Tongue Twister
mission.desc: And finally we have last month's double champions! If you can pronounce this one, well done! Although technically it's just the name of the parasite. Who knows what the frog is called.

mission.name: The Barfis Brothers
mission.desc: The three brothers were raised in a lab to be super soldiers. But the infighting scientists let them escape and eventually you might find the super soldiers in super flasks.

mission.name: Celebrating Year 1
mission.desc: It's anniversary time! Which means it's time to visit all our favorite Party Titans and Mythics!

line.text: Drinks? Check. Snacks? Check. Music? Check.
I throw my hands up! They're playing my song! The butterflies fly away!
I'm noddin' my head like yeah!
Wait? What are you doing here? You're not on the guest list!

mission.name: Celebrating Year 2
mission.desc: This anniversary, though, there seems to be one angel particularly ready to party.

line.text: This guy with you?
No? I thought you invited him.
It's our party, we can do what what we want!
It's our party, we can say what what we want!
So la-da-di-da-di, we like to party!

mission.name: Celebrating Year 3
mission.desc: This anniversary, Batara fought for his right to party. He's going to enjoy every moment of it.

line.text: I like to party too, but why are you here?
You've got to fight. For your right. To...
Yes. Yes. Yes. I am aware of how that goes.
Look, I've spent years... YEARS... waiting for my moment to shine.
And these two months, I've been living my best life so you're not going to stop me having a party.
I CAME IN LIKE A WRECKING BALL!

mission.name: Celebrating Year 4
mission.desc: This anniversary, the DJ appears to have an interesting choice of music.

line.text: OK, who chose this playlist?
If it hadn't been for these two months, I'd been lost long time ago.
Where did you come from?
Where will you go?
Where did you come from?

mission.name: Celebrating Year 5
mission.desc: This anniversary, the party guests couldn't agree on how to decorate the towers.

line.text: Who chose to pick out these towers?! They absolutely don't go with the rest of the effect I was going for this party!
Don't look at me, I'm just here living my best life.
OK! Own up! Which one of you tried to burn my Tree of Eternity?!
I'm looking at you Mr. Scorchbreath!
BURRP! Oh sorry was that not a party activity?

mission.name: Celebrating Year 6
mission.desc: This anniversary, everyone knew that one guest who was trouble when they walked in.

line.text: Man this year has been a BLAST! Got my rework done. Dating this new Chief. New year. New era. New me.
This year, I'm ''him''. Just dominating. I've been everywhere. Global tour.
I've been chilling as per usual.
Same, bro, same. Except just this last month.
I'm really sorry, Batara, but I don't see your name on the invite list.
No problem. See this blank space? I'll write your name.

mission.name: Celebrating Year 7
mission.desc: This anniversary, the hot topic was what everyone choose to accessorize with their outfit.

line.text: Say, Narix, buddy. What are you sporting with that new look?
I've been trying out a few things myself since that new range of runes dropped this year.
Health is so last year's fashion now, right?
I'm waiting for them to launch the dualstrike range myself.

mission.name: Celebrating Year 8
mission.desc: This anniversary, the party cost so much money, it ran out of gold for an artist to bring a Party Mythic to life.

line.text: Who the heck blew the budget set aside for the party decorations on all these gaudy stones?
Do you think I'm made of gold or something?
Next year, I'm going to have to hire an artist.
Don't look at me. I only spent my money on stones to upgrade myself.

mission.name: Celebrating Year 9
mission.desc: And finally this anniversary, we finally got to celebrate the Mythic formerly known as the Forgotten Hero.

line.text: Wait? Viracocha, you're not the Forgotten Hero. Where's Party Mythic Lev?
Have you not been reading the story?
... there's a story?
Sigh. Lev is trapped in the Deep Void. How would she be able to get to this party?
Hey, Party Batara... Partyara... *chuckles* maybe you can pretend to be Lev since your Daze is a Heartseeker right now.
Or maybe I was Lev disguised as Batara all along...
